message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.MA

The paper introduces a method for model-based tuning of the exploration schedule in sequential decision problems. This involves machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques, which are covered by the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The method also takes into account the time horizon of the decision problem and the agent's current state of knowledge, which relates to the cs.SY sub-category. The paper applies the method to several common exploration techniques in different decision problem settings, which could fall under the cs.DS sub-category. Finally, the paper examines the effects of the accuracy of the estimated dynamics model on the performance of the method, which could be relevant to the cs.MA sub-category.
